alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:44PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alleghany, northwestern Rockbridge, Bath and northwestern Botetourt Counties in west central Virginia, Greenbrier, Summers and northern Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia and the City of Covington through 730 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Millboro to near Sandstone. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Clifton Forge... Lewisburg... Hinton... White Sulphur Springs... and Ronceverte. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier
